explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Steel and aluminum can be used as a container. (Hommel, 1991)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: > 5000 mg/kg REFERENCE SOURCE: SIDS (1999), ACGIH (2001)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LD50 >5000mg/kg (ACGIH (2001), SIDS (1999)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Rat LC50: 32000ppm (75.8mg/L) (SIDS (1999)) Since this value was outside of the range of 2.5 times of judgment criteria of Category 4 (50mg/L), it was classified as out of Category. (20degC. The saturated air of acetone are 230000ppm, and it is considered that all inhalation toxicity study was done in the state of steam.)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as out of Category from the statement of having no stimulativeness on rabbit skin (EHC 207 (1998)) and (SIDS (1999)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Vapor stimulates public eye. However, if exposure stops, irritation will not follow (ATSDR (1994)). The result of severe is reported in the rabbit (ACGIH (2001)). Although a corneal epithelium is destroyed, substrate is not destroyed, and destruction of a corneal epithelium will be recovered in 4-6 days. Acetone is not corrosive eye irritations (SIDS (1999)). It was set as Category 2B from the above description.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since it was indicated negative by the Mouse ear swelling test and Guinea pig maximization test(SIDS (1999)), the skin sensitization was put outside of the Category. Since there is no data, the respiratory sensitization cannot be classified.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: We found the negative results for in vivo micronucleus examination (SIDS (1999), EHC 207 (1998)), therefore we classified it as Out Of Category by the technical guideline.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It is ACGIH A4(ACGIH (2001)), and categoried the outside of Category from the technical indicator.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is a report that he has no effect on a miscarriage in an epidemiological study (ATSDR, 1994). It is reported of slight developmental toxicity (decrease of embryo weight) in rat high concentration exposure (11000 ppm (20 mg/L)) (EHC, 207 (1998)) and of the decrease of embryo weight and the increase of late embryo absortion rate in mouse high concentration exposure (6600 ppm (15.6 mg/L)) (EHC, 207 (1998)). There is a description that study is still more nearly required, for an animal with humans (EHC). And it is classified into the Category 2 the above thing.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the descriptions that irritation in the human throat is caused by 1200ppm exposure (ACGIH (2001)), that irritation is caused in the nasal cavity, throat and trachea by 1190 and 2400mg/m3/6h exposure to humans (ECH 207 (1998)), and that irritation was caused in the throat by 1000ppm/4h exposure (ECH 207 (1998)). So it was set as Category 3 (airway irritation). And the discriptions that a male who drank 200ml fell coma (recovering his conciousness in 12 hours), and that a worker exposed to 12000ppm experienced headache, dizziness, leg weakness and fainting (ACGIH (2001)). So it was also set as Category 3 ( anesthetic actions) based on the descriptions that a male who drank 200 ml fell coma, recovering his conciousness in 12 hours, and that a worker exposed to 12000 ppm experienced headache, dizziness, leg weakness and dead faint(ACGIH (2001)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (blood) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 2, since by the examination using volunteers, the significant increase in white corpuscles and an eosinophil and the significant reduction of a phagocytosis of a neutrophil were observed in the exposure group with 500 ppm, 6 hours/day for 6 days (ACGIH (2001)). In the examination using the rat and the mouse, although it was a dose greatly beyond guidance limits, the similar haematological changes like in humans was admitted (SIDS (1999)). Since in other examination using a rat and a mouse , each is over the guidance limits (ACGIH (2001)),(SIDS (1999)) and there is also no example of a report in humans, they were not adopted as a classification basis.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: The calculated dynamic viscosity is 0.426mm2/sec and there was not the animal data of chemical pneumonia, however, it was the ketone of under C13, therefore it was classified into Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50>100mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (EHC207, 1998).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=1.00*106mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
